bibdata.title: Replace voyager fixtures with alma fixtures in traject tests

comments.body:
@mzelesky I can't find a fixture to satisfy this condition https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/97420778d2d92b0bbba7906d680cda0cae2adf49/spec/marc_to_solr/lib/config_spec.rb#L357-L359. 
I also don't understand what does `not-ceased_008` https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/97420778d2d92b0bbba7906d680cda0cae2adf49/spec/marc_to_solr/lib/config_spec.rb#L298-L301 mean. 
I can find 008-6 with c (no d) and the publication end date displays for both https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/997928443506421 https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/997608663506421/ .
It does not display for https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/997622433506421/.
Maybe you can help me to understand.

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/41154346/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/41154346)

Coverage increased (+0.09%) to 96.826% when pulling **48fa9b25c59497052b7f9b7ca87d5c5ba5ae4b2d on alma** into **45d9d4a0e88f5de912132a9e17fba44dc5753c2d on main**.

orangelight.title: Check for digital object linked to parent record (773$w)

comments.body:
6910125 is displaying the MVW manifest (you can tell by the ToC), and 6910128 is showing the viewer for just the volume.

One could argue this is correct?

Yes, this is a good setup, and the goal for this ticket was to get this behavior. I looked at the records again and now I see that the volume has 6910128 as the source metadata identifier, which is why it's displaying on the child volume.

Going forward, I think we are going to structure things differently and only create a (non-MVW) for ScannedResource for sammelbands, and use structure to represent the volumes/internal structure instead of creating volumes and separate digital objects for each one. So I think we'll need to update the query to see if Figgy has any objects to check the items bib, and also 773$w if that's present.
Host records are changing a bit in Alma, safe to take off the high priority label?
Yes, that makes sense — I've removed the `high-priority` label. This ticket can be prioritized with all the other digital projects work later this year.

comments.body:
Spoke with Peter B. about this we can change the current:

```This item is not accessible to any patron. Library staff will work to try to get you access to a copy of the desired material.``` 

to:
 
```This item is temporarily not accessible as a result of our current system migration [link to https://library.princeton.edu/news/general/2021-08-02/pul-launch-new-library-system-summer-2021-hathitrust-etas-update]. Library staff will work to try to get you access to a copy of the desired material.```

requests.title: What happens when Alma has a barcode but it is not real (i.e Holdings with no attached item records)

comments.body: I think we need to spend some time testing this scenario.

Annex Item: https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/requests/9915485853506421?mfhd=22272080260006421&source=pulsearch

Falls back appropriately.

Firestone Items: https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/requests/998820893506421?mfhd=22272042640006421&source=pulsearch, https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/requests/9920476063506421?mfhd=22272024600006421&source=pulsearch

Falls back appropriately
I think we are in good shape with this use case.

comments.body: The final work order state is "Preservation and Conservation". Currently showing up as green and "Not Available". Items in this state should be treated like items out on loan or lost and be routed to resource sharing.
